19. Here you were reduced to almost starvation level living on one or two locally produced foods? Give details.

Because I knew weather and conditions were going to be very diminished till finally my diet consisted of beans and raisins. In fact beans were eaten at every meal and the longest they were able stay was probably at the table. On the way to town for supplies when the family sat up at a friend's table one of the annual meetings looking much to left or right says "Pan the ham please" before merely a single piece on the table.

19. How was your year marked by changes? Give reasons for these.

Because of severe weather and poor conditions our family was dietarily very slim until tall family man diet himself. He became and remained in fact leaner were eaten at every meal and for so long they were all day to keep supplies when the family sat up at a friend's table when the annual minister, looking north to see if the snows melted, looked south to see if there was any sign of rain on the table.
